page.title: 03CLIFF LANDSCAPE
page.content: Sandown and Shanklin cliffs are made of lower greensand which is a type of sandstone.There are birds which nest in holes in the cliff.They use the wet sand to build their nests.These do not spoil the overall appearance of the cliff,because they build their nests on the ledges.Before 1971,when the sea defence wall was built,the cliff was being eroded quite rapidly .The sea wall forms a link between Hope Beach and Yaverland,along which authorised vehicles can travel.It also can be a pleasant walk.At{Sandown the beach was {popular enough to be considered a {Euro-beach in 1973/4}and was free enough from pollution to pass.However, there are some sewage outlets coming from the sea defence wall.
